captions.text:
Hey Vsauce, I'm Jake, and I'm here in a hotel
in Japan. Now, Japan has some of the most

recognizable video games like Mario, Final
Fantasy, Metal Gear Sold, and most recently,

Latino Turtle Fighter, which is the title
I made with the Video Game Name Generator.

The game has characters like Squirtpoke, Charduck,
and whatever other Frankenstein monsters you
want to create with Pokemon Fusion.

But let's leave Japan and go to London to
check out Michael's DONG's...things that you

can Do Online Now Guys. In fact, he has 31
dongs, just for you. What would the internet

be without Giantbatfarts.com, or an entire
website that is literally just a pug licking
your screen.

Astronauts explore the stars, internauts explore
the internet. Come with me.

First stop, the stars. Wechoosethemoon recreates
the Apollo 11 launch that first put humans

on Earth's Moon. With audio from the actual
events and lots of history and info, it's

a great resource. But if you're curious to
know what being on Mars would be like, there's

this gigapan image which will blow your mind.
It is amazing.

By the way, the word "amazing" comes from
the word "maze." Something that is amazing

is like a maze- stupefying, confusing, a challenge
to understand and conquer right away. Walter

Pullen's website full of mazes he built is
amazing. For instance, the current record

holder for largest maze- a 12 1/2 megabit
bit map with 2,534,438 dead ins.

Our brain is also amazing, and at TEDActive
this year I spoke about how much a video weighs.

You can watch my TED talk on YouTube right
now by following the link in this video's

description, where links to all these DONG's
are, but the point is, while at TEDActive

this year, I met Amy Robinson from MIT, who
introduced me to EyeWire.org- a game that

allows you to help science map individual
neurons in the brain. With over 60,000 players

from 100 countries, EyeWire serves you up
a tiny section of the retina, and challenges
you to improve the work already done by AI.

SalmonofCapistrano.com is a masterpiece, and
the Boobah Zone is a playground of fun and

confusion. Eggwatchers.com lets you pick how
you want your egg boiled. Just put your egg

in boiling water, and then the site will serve
you a YouTube video that's eggsactly long

enough. When the video's done, your egg is
ready.

This site allows you to list and rank your
favorite games. It then aggregates all of

its user's lists to compile a master countdown
of the top games ever. Or, browse a list of

the smallest things ever. Smalleststuff.com
covers the smallest optical mouse, the smallest
animals, the smallest train set, and more.

Back to Bed is a beautifully surreal game
where you play the protector of sleepwalking

Bob. Navigate him through his dreams to safety,
avoiding falls and creatures from his nightmares.

Speaking of nightmares, Monoface allows you
to click and exchange the eyes, ears, mouths,

and head and shoulders of a bunch of people.
There are over 700,000 possible different
faces.

If that's too scary, make 8-bit sound effects
instead. Start with a basic coin noise, jump

sound, explosion- whatever. And then meticulously
adjust every aspect to create your own personal

8-bit sound effects. Or, use your arrow keys
and space bar to play 8-bit Fruit Ninja.

Eriba Science Hall allows you to literally
scroll into the human body and find out how
aging affects cells, DNA, and more.

elgoog.im contains Google's famous interactive
homepage tools, as well as some fun ones like

Underwater. Search for things to have images
of it dropped into the water your search bar

is floating in. Then, listen to Bitcoin transactions
in real time with listentobitcoin.com. Now

this site shows bubbles every time a Bitcoin
transaction takes place. The size of the bubble

and the sound it makes is tied to the size
of the transaction.

If you haven't seen these next two YouTube
videos before, I don't know where you've been,

but they are amazing, and an impressive testament
to what fans are capable of making. The first

is the complete movie Toy Story recreated
in real life. On a related note, who could

forget the recreation of Star Wars: A New
Hope, where every 15 seconds was made by a
different person.

And one of my favorite Sub Reddit's is InternetisBeautiful,
where today I found YouTube Cleaner- search

for videos and watch them in a clean, clutter-free
environment. If you follow me on Twitter you

may have already seen Taste Kid. Enter your
favorite music, movies, TV shows, books, authors,

or games, and get back a list of related things
you might also like.

In the past I have also shared Ishkur's Guide
to Electronic Music, because I love thinking

about genres. But, today, I discovered this
one and promptly spent hours on it. If you're

not sure which style is for you, use stereomood.com.
Select a mood and get music delivered to you

to fit your mood or change it. Once you're
jamming, and what the kids call "midfunk,"

challenge yourself- how long can you remain
midfunk?

And, in case of emergency, instantdanceparty.com.
Have fun in Japan, Jake. Subscribe to Vsauce

3 if you aren't already, and, as always, thanks
for watching.
